summary.Title: Network Specialist
summary.Presentation:

JobPositionInformation.Purpose:
Would you like to contribute to the Femern project, Northern Europe’s biggest construction project building the longest immersed tunnel in the world?

We are currently looking for an experienced Network Specialist to join our team.

You will play a central role in the administration and maintenance of our IT infrastructure, especially our extensive network that spans our construction sites.

About us:

Femern Link Contractors, FLC, is the joint venture responsible for the design and construction of the immersed tunnel, tunnel portals and ramps. Our joint venture consists of nine international construction companies with individual experience in large infrastructure projects.

The infrastructure team consists of three people who are responsible for the establishment, maintenance and operation of FLC's network and server infrastructure. The team is part of the IT department, a team of 13 skilled, fun and enthusiastic colleagues who are responsible for running FLC's IT with over 1000 users spread over several locations in two countries. The corporate language is English, in which you must be proficient in writing as well as speaking.

Reporting to the IT Infrastructure Manager, you will be responsible for ensuring that our network and connections run optimally. Therefore, we expect you to have a good understanding of network architecture and design, data flow, routing and to have the ability to troubleshoot in a larger, complex network.

Main Responsibilities:

• Establishment and operation of our Unifi based network in Røby on Fehmarn and in Copenhagen.

• Maintenance and monitoring of our Sophos firewalls and VPN based WAN.

• Documentation.

• Monitoring of infrastructure, networks and applications.

• Configuration, troubleshooting and optimization at a technically and professionally high level, where you will have the opportunity to spar with skilled colleagues.

Requirements:

You have experience with networks and network operations and are ready to take on a senior role, where you will, to a certain extent also act as a mentor for apprentices and less experienced employees in the team. On the technical side, our network consists of Sophos firewalls and Unifi/Ubiquity controllers, switches and access points.

Workplace:

You will be based in Rødby, but your tasks will also be on Fehmarn, Germany and in Copenhagen.

Application:

If this opportunity interests you, we look forward to receiving your application IN ENGLISH as soon as possible and no later than 07.02.2025. Applications will be processed on an ongoing basis, and the recruitment process will be completed once we find the right profile.

Contact Information:

For questions related to the position, please contact IT Infrastructure Manager Morten Ryom at +45 5330 3651.
